components.description: A mound of shaved ice (snow cone) served in a dessert bowl with a short spoon, flavored with a cherry-red syrup on many platforms. Associated with Hawaiian shave ice or Japanese kakigori.
components.title: Shaved Ice

description: A mound of shaved ice (snow cone) served in a dessert bowl with a short spoon, flavored with a cherry-red syrup on many platforms. Associated with Hawaiian shave ice or Japanese kakigori.
title: Shaved Ice

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Food symbol
emoji_net_data.definition: Shaved ice with syrup added to it for flavor. Often referred to as a¬†snow cone. Shaved Ice was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and a http://emojipedia.org/shaved-ice/
emoji_net_data.name: shaved ice

bn:00099981a: Having a low or inadequate temperature or feeling a sensation of coldness or having been made cold by e.g. ice or refrigeration

bn:00111540a: Having or denoting the characteristic taste of sugar
Having the taste characteristic of sugar or honey.

bn:00087460v: To consume something solid or semi-solid (usually food) by putting it into the mouth and eventually swallowing it.
To consume (something solid or semi-solid, usually food) by putting it into the mouth and swallowing it.

bn:00045722n: Ice cream is a frozen food usually made from dairy products, such as milk and cream and often combined with fruits or other ingredients and flavors.
Frozen dessert containing cream and sugar and flavoring
A cold dessert (made of water, cream and milk, combined with flavourings, emulsifiers and sugar) that's popular when it's hot.
A dessert made from frozen sweetened cream or a similar substance, usually flavoured.

bn:00075151n: Summer is the warmest of the four temperate seasons, falling between spring and autumn.
The period or season of summer.
One of the four seasons, between Spring and Autumn
The warmest season of the year; in the northern hemisphere it extends from the summer solstice to the autumnal equinox
The time during the summer months.

bn:03675112n: Shaved ice is a large family of ice-based dessert made of fine shavings of ice or finely crushed ice and sweet condiments or syrups.

bn:00001880n: A sweet confection served as the last course of a meal
A dish served as the last course of a meal
A usage seen in the United Kingdom and some other Commonwealth countries.
Dessert is a typically sweet course that concludes an evening meal.
A sweet confection served as the last course of a meal.
Sweet confection served as the last course of a meal.
Sweet course that concludes a meal

bn:03675115n: Shave ice or Hawaiian shave ice is an ice-based dessert made by shaving a block of ice.
